column4: I'm having trouble with GNOME.  If I click on the date/time in the upper right hand corner of the screen, I used to get a calendar.  Now all it does is lock up the entire taskbar and i have to kill X and relogin to get it working again.  Help!
are you wearing a red cap
I'm assuming I have to remove it first?
And isn't it a dependency of ubuntu-desktop?
I can't remove it, ubuntu-desktop depends on gnome-applets
actually aptitude is giving me an option to downgrade it
and I already upgraded back (because of a noficiation that said i was out of date)
but it should be 'reinstalled' in that case
the only other guy talking to me is spouting nonsense
what the heck, don't name yourself after a nickelodeon character and then not fulfill the persona. you wear a red cap and melt when you need to slip under doors!
